revision.comment: Hammer5000 moved page [[Talk:S-300 (missile system)]] to [[Talk:S-300 missile system]]: Follow same naving convention as other similar articles
revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=Start |old-peer-review=yes |Weaponry-task-force=yes |B-Class-1=no |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes}} {{WikiProject Soviet Union|class=C|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Russia|class=C|importance=Top|tech=yes|mil=yes}} }} >>> Correct translation is needed within this article. Many aspects are done through automatic translation and lack any clarity. [[User:Tapalmer99|Tapalmer99]] ([[User talk:Tapalmer99|talk]]) 15:17, 1 October 2015 (UTC) [[Special:Contributions/68.198.101.174|68.198.101.174]] ([[User talk:68.198.101.174|talk]]) 15:17, 1 October 2015 (UTC) == Users - Azerbaijan & Armenia == Last update has been deleted! The Azerbaijan bought the PMU2 version last year (2010) and it's been confirmed by many media companies that this is true. Azerbaijan will buy 2 batteries S-300PMU2 missiles, where as a standard S-12 battery comprises of 2 Giant missile launchers and 2 Gladiator launchers. Recent announcements about Armenian armed forces bought the S-300 missiles are not confirmed and only a political move against Azerbaijan and Russian side did not confirm the Armenian purchase. As the Armenian defense ministry announced that some of the units where operated by Armenian servicemen, this does not mean that the missiles are in Armenian service. The Russians still owns the entire S-300 missile complexes where the Armenian personel only operates them under Russian command, not more not less. The Azerbaijani armed forces bought them and will be trained and put operational under Azeri command.[[User:Sonertje80|Sonertje80]] ([[User talk:Sonertje80|talk]]) 20:22, 12 April 2011 (UTC) Armenian forces operate S-300 PM and PT versions around Yerevan, the russian S-300 V is in the russian military base in Gyumri and is operated by russian soldiers but commanded by russian and armenian staff. There are photos and videos too. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/79.253.11.152|79.253.11.152]] ([[User talk:79.253.11.152|talk]]) 23:08, 15 July 2011 (UTC) == Users - Czechoslovakia and Slovakia == Czechoslovakia got S-300PMU with 5V55R missiles in 1990 (to equip one SAM battalion) and Slovakia inherited this system in 1993. There was wrong info that CS got it in 1985 - this is evidently mistaken with S-200 system and in the same line was another mistake that Slovakia got it in 1992 which is nonsense as Slovakia did not exist as independent state in that year (independence since 1993). Regards Pavel Novak —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:PN79|PN79]] ([[User talk:PN79|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/PN79|contribs]]) 18:35, 12 March 2010 (UTC) == Max engagement altitude? == So, what is the max engagement altitude for the S-300 SAM? For a SAM this information is very important. Somebody who knows about this SAM, please add this information here. It would be helpful if the max alitutude is mentioned for each S-300 version. I am assuming that when the designers improved the max range they also improved the max engagement altitude. Thanks.. [[User:Raza0007|Raza0007]] 05:59, 18 February 2007 (UTC) :According to the Rosoboronexport catalog it's 27 km for the PMU-1 and PMU-2 and 30 km for the V and VM variants. They didn't specify for which missiles though. - [[User:Dammit|Dammit]] 22:19, 28 February 2007 (UTC) ---- Is the missile really the SA-10 or the SA-14 (or somehow both)? If it's the SA-10, the reference to "SA-14" should be changed. If it's the [[SA-14 Gremlin|SA-14]], the info on it should be moved there and SA-10 made a redirect to [[Systems Concepts]]. If the missile is both, [[SA-14 Gremlin|SA-14]] should be created, perhaps as a redirect. --[[User:SHeumann|SHeumann]] 05:37, 19 Jun 2004 (UTC) ----The SA-14 is a handheld missile, the SA-10 is a massive ballistic missile. Someone apparantly fixed this a while ago, someone had SA-7 and SA-10 mixed up (somehow). [[User:Nvinen|Nvinen]] 03:20, 17 Jan 2005 (UTC) ---- I still need to do some work on the radar section. [[User:Nvinen|Nvinen]] 16:22, 12 Jan 2005 (UTC) ---- "Max. Speed" in the table was changed to "Speed". I changed it to "Top Speed" because "Speed" is too ambiguous. It could refer to average speed, which is a different figure. These figures are approximate but they're approximate maximums; at such high speeds, friction will be incredible and missile speed will drop rapidly, so average speed will most likely be lower for all but the shorter engagements. [[User:Nvinen|Nvinen]] 01:41, 30 Jan 2005 (UTC) :I changed "Top Speed" to "Maximum Velocity" because, to be perfectly honest, I think it sounds better.[[User:Oceanhahn|Oceanhahn]] 02:10, 13 April 2006 (UTC) ---- Why is it that all the articles here are listed by their NATO nicknames instead of their proper production names, anyway? Doesn't make a whole lot of sense, if you ask me, but whatever. [[User:Oceanhahn|Oceanhahn]] 02:10, 13 April 2006 (UTC) :Just on ocaasion, i believe. If an article was originated by a western men, it gets a name from "NATO reporting codename" list. If, say, me is the originator, i'll use "native" name. Nevertheless, there are redirects which do the proper things. --[[User:Jno|jno]] 11:46, 14 April 2006 (UTC) == 'Big' missile == I'd like to see some sources for the 'Big' missile as part of the S-300 system. As far as I could find the missile is at most ''compatible'' with the S-300 system, but was developed as a part of the [[S-400]] program. [http://www.fas.org/nuke/guide/russia/airdef/s-400.htm FAS.org - "S-400 SA-20 Triumf"] supports that, as do the the websites mentioned in this article under [[SA-10_Grumble#External_links|External links]] by stating the maximum range at 200km. - [[User:Dammit|Dammit]] 23:12, 22 April 2006 (UTC) === Wot ?! === wot ?! lol 9M82\83M VM\VM2\VMD 300km\V4 400km und pmu2\pm2\favorit\S400 48N6 i 40N6 are not f* enough for u ?! xD lookat miltomsk about s300\400\500 , 7N6 (77N6 ?) is another like previous S500 can carry different things also paraly hypothized also 3M22 Tsirkon --[[User:Zafer14ur8|Zafer14ur8]] ([[User talk:Zafer14ur8|talk]]) 14:49, 15 January 2016 (UTC) rub&sap == Regarding Rosoboronexport Ext. Link == It's a little hard to think of it as an ad since anyone finding themselves in the position to purchase such a system would probably ''not'' be doing their shopping on Wikipedia. Thank you, [[User:Kazuaki Shimazaki|Kazuaki Shimazaki]], for restoring the link. --[[User:Oceanhahn|Oceanhahn]] 02:14, 27 May 2006 (UTC) == Move to S-300 == I'd like to see this article moved to its proper, native name from its NATO codename. I've already started moving the other missile launchers in this series to their appropriate pages; some were already there. t seems to make more sense to call them by their names, rather than nicknames given to them by some other agency. This article, however, is written more to the tune of "SA-10", though it still consistently refers to it as "S-300". I'll move it soon, unless there's a compelling argument to the contrary. --[[User:Oceanhahn|Oceanhahn]] 02:53, 27 May 2006 (UTC) :'''Agree''', in fact, in my opinion we need a naming convention for this since there are a few exceptions. [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (aircraft)]] could be a good starting point for a first draft. By the way, note that S-300 wouldn't be a very good name for the article, because of the ambiguaty with the S-300V (SA-12). S-300P won't have that problem so my preference goes to that. - [[User:Dammit|Dammit]] 13:52, 27 May 2006 (UTC) ::Note (rarely used) name S-300F for naval version. This one differs from both P and V. --[[User:Jno|jno]] 08:18, 29 May 2006 (UTC) :Just fuse the two. That way, you can talk about how the two systems diverged, and there is almost nothing in the SA-12 page compared to the SA-10 page. [[User:Kazuaki Shimazaki|Kazuaki Shimazaki]] 02:06, 29 May 2006 (UTC) == Merger == I agree with what [[User:Kazuaki Shimazaki|Kazuaki Shimazaki]] suggested in the move to S-300 thread above. The S-300V is just a subversion of this one. - [[User:Dammit|Dammit]] 11:35, 16 June 2006 (UTC) :I've started writing on the merger in the weekend since noone opposed, it's progressing nicely at the moment (I'm using the occasion to rewrite all the NATO reporting names to actual designations). Just dropping a message here so you all know that the merger isn't inactive. - [[User:Dammit|Dammit]] 21:54, 26 June 2006 (UTC) ==='''pro'''=== # --[[User:Jno|jno]] 07:36, 19 June 2006 (UTC) ==='''contra'''=== == Good work == This is a very well laid out article, I think. It only wish all the others like it would not only come together so well, but also so completely. Good stuff here! --[[User:Oceanhahn|Oceanhahn]] 19:25, 30 June 2006 (UTC) == Croatian S-300s ?! == The article [[Croatian ground army]] states that Croatia operates 12x S-300, is that true, because it is not mentioned in this article? [[User:Dragoljub Kojadinovic|Dragoljub Kojadinovic]] 00:31, 23 May 2007 (UTC) *--[[User:Rqasd|Rqasd]] ([[User talk:Rqasd|talk]]) 13:52, 28 October 2013 (UTC)there is no AI for Croatian s-300 but there are AI that was never Croatian s-300 and only sometimes only parts, broken because these little parts to work == Cheese Board == I have some sources which indicate that the NATO CodeName of the 96L6 radar is the "CHEESE BOARD" [[User:Dougsnow|Dougsnow]] 18:36, 24 July 2007 (UTC) lol — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/188.162.80.2|188.162.80.2]] ([[User talk:188.162.80.2|talk]]) 12:16, 7 August 2016 (UTC) == S-300P series and S-300V series == ...are entirely different systems, confused a lot with eachother due to similar designation. They should definitely be separated to own pages, containing all the subversions of each system (aka: S-300P would discuss P,PMU (-2,-3) and similarly for S-300V family). As for croatian systems, I believe they only managed to obtain missile launchers, but not the radar vehicles. Sources on this deal are poor... [[User:TouchTold|TouchTold]] ([[User talk:TouchTold|talk]]) 00:19, 14 January 2008 (UTC) :I'll disagree. The reason they had been brought together is that the two complexes actually originated from the same program, which effectively split due to Soviet bureaucracy b/w the Army and the PVO --[[User:Kazuaki Shimazaki|Kazuaki Shimazaki]] ([[User talk:Kazuaki Shimazaki|talk]]) 03:57, 15 January 2008 (UTC) ::I agree that the two should probably be seperated since they are both entirely seperate systems in terms of design, designation and purpose. Its ok to group all the S-300 derivatives together and if the S-300V were a modification like PMU or a adaptation like Fort of the S-300 then it would be justified but it really is a very different system and should be treated as such with its own page, theres enougth info out there to do it.[[User:Typhoon9410|Typhoon9410]] ([[User talk:Typhoon9410|talk]]) 17:20, 13 March 2008 (UTC) *knowing the sites of producers and developers of s-300 + works of historians of the s-300 I tell you that with 300V is completely different from the s-300P even more than from naval respect to P s300--[[User:Rqasd|Rqasd]] ([[User talk:Rqasd|talk]]) 13:55, 28 October 2013 (UTC) == Venezuela == This link could be considered for the reflist (Footnotes) denoting Venezuela's purchase of an air defense system from Belarus and its interest in the S-300 system http://www.neurope.eu/articles/84804.php [[User:QueueNut|QueueNut]] ([[User talk:QueueNut|talk]]) 21:20, 5 July 2008 (UTC) :Venezuela got its missiles in March 2012, but does somebody have a better ref than this please? http://bmpd.livejournal.com/186218.html [[User:Hcobb|Hcobb]] ([[User talk:Hcobb|talk]]) 14:44, 9 October 2012 (UTC) == Iran's S-300 == "Iran (not delivered yet)[2]" I am not sure but this point could be in dispute. [http://archive.newsmax.com/archives/articles/2001/2/11/183950.shtml] "According to defense intelligence officials, joint Russian/Iranian crews currently man two S-300 units just outside of Tehran and Iranian Army soldiers are now undergoing operational training on the advanced missile system in Moscow." But I concede that the BBC report is more recent. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Medfreak|Medfreak]] ([[User talk:Medfreak|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Medfreak|contribs]]) 13:49, 8 July 2008 (UTC) :: A new Report by the Jpost claiming Iran to recieve S-300 by the end of the year through Belarous. [http://www.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1215331076183&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull] —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Medfreak|Medfreak]] ([[User talk:Medfreak|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Medfreak|contribs]]) 18:01, 25 July 2008 (UTC) == S-300/Patriot user image == Could someone update the picture to include Taiwan as a Patriot user? Thanks. [[User:John Smith's|John Smith's]] ([[User talk:John Smith's|talk]]) 09:25, 31 August 2008 (UTC) ==In Yugoslavia?== Someone tolds SA-10 being in service in Yugoslavia, and even one battery was shot by a F-16. This seems very unlikely,but i am wondering if nobody knows or confirm this fact?--[[User:Stefanomencarelli|Stefanomencarelli]] ([[User talk:Stefanomencarelli|talk]]) 19:47, 7 December 2008 (UTC) *--[[User:Rqasd|Rqasd]] ([[User talk:Rqasd|talk]]) 13:57, 28 October 2013 (UTC)to NATO's attack on Yugoslavia were pictures that s-300V Yugoslavia, they came and then with the specification that it was a hoax for NATO invented Yugoslavia that http://politikus.politikus.politikus.ru/events/8613-podvodnyy-s-300-v-stepyah-serbii.html — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/188.162.80.2|188.162.80.2]] ([[User talk:188.162.80.2|talk]]) 12:11, 7 August 2016 (UTC) == Possible future operators == Why the [[fnord]] does this section exist? And if we must have it, can we at least get a ref for each and every entry please? [[User:Hcobb|Hcobb]] ([[User talk:Hcobb|talk]]) 12:21, 4 August 2009 (UTC) I don't understand the claim made in this section that "Since Syrian Air Defense Force teams have already trained in the Russian Federation on the handling of the S-300 interceptor batteries, they can go into service as soon as they are landed by one of Russia's daily airlifts to Syria. Russian air defence officials will supervise their deployment and prepare them for operation." I'm interested by this claim but I cannot find it substantiated anywhere else. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/86.12.61.184|86.12.61.184]] ([[User talk:86.12.61.184|talk]]) 01:53, 31 May 2013 (UTC) == Does it destroy ballistic missiles or the targets of ballistic missiles? == There's a sentence in the article that says "The S-300 is also capable of destroying ballistic missile targets", which would imply that it would be used to destroy cities, factories, military bases, etc. -- i.e., the targets of ballistic missiles. Is it really supposed to mean "The S-300 is also capable of targeting and destroying ballistic missiles"? * not very old versions of s-300 initially can be ballistic missiles )))) 100%--[[User:Rqasd|Rqasd]] ([[User talk:Rqasd|talk]]) 13:08, 23 October 2013 (UTC)an authoritative source in the media?? it was a military secret) but many systems claim shooting at the planes and aerodrome too--[[User:Rqasd|Rqasd]] ([[User talk:Rqasd|talk]]) 13:08, 23 October 2013 (UTC) ---- Assumption made that its target is missiles (and hence the statement is redundant given previous paragraphs). Removed presumed ambiguity.--[[User:Jhfrontz|Jhfrontz]] ([[User talk:Jhfrontz|talk]]) 21:21, 19 December 2009 (UTC) + yes http://naviny.by/rubrics/politic/2011/10/17/ic_articles_112_175478/ — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/195.218.182.126|195.218.182.126]] ([[User talk:195.218.182.126|talk]]) 12:45, 9 March 2015 (UTC) ==The Machine ''Itself''== Knowing all about the vehicles combat capabilities is all well and good, but ¿what about the machine itself? For example, the engines, drivetrain (8X8, 8X4, 8X2; ¿How does it run?), etc.[[Special:Contributions/174.25.7.35|174.25.7.35]] ([[User talk:174.25.7.35|talk]]) 03:08, 27 October 2009 (UTC)A REDDSON Vehicles are standard Soviet/Russian and can be found through links [[User:Tapalmer99|Tapalmer99]] ([[User talk:Tapalmer99|talk]]) 15:21, 1 October 2015 (UTC) ==Iran SA300== Asked when Russia would deliver the systems to Iran, Ivanov said: "There have been no such deliveries to date." This excerpt replaced the former 'Russia will not supply Iran with SA300' because no where in the source does it imply that this transaction will not take place. So by writing "there have have been no such deliveries to date (in the source's [Russian Deputy Prime Minister Sergei Ivanov] own words were not ruling out the possibility of it in the future. In short, the Russians have never come out and said, we will never sell it to the Iranians, they have only made it clear that it has not happened up to this date. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/24.80.105.24|24.80.105.24]] ([[User talk:24.80.105.24|talk]]) 01:45, 29 October 2009 (UTC) * reported talks about the delivery of S-300ВМ instead С300pmu — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Rqasd|Rqasd]] ([[User talk:Rqasd|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Rqasd|contribs]]) 13:02, 23 October 2013 (UTC) == "TEL"? == The article mentions "TEL" a number of times. I'll guess that the "L" is "Launcher"; what's the rest? In any case, it should be defined before it is used. --[[Special:Contributions/66.30.251.99|66.30.251.99]] ([[User talk:66.30.251.99|talk]]) 23:05, 17 February 2010 (UTC) Hi, this means 'Tracked Erector Launcher' it is used in all launcher vehicles where the missile would be erected to launching position like the SCUD.[[User:Sonertje80|Sonertje80]] ([[User talk:Sonertje80|talk]]) 20:26, 12 April 2011 (UTC) :Actually, it's Transporter-Erector-Launcher; the transporter needn't be tracked.--[[Special:Contributions/172.190.41.82|172.190.41.82]] ([[User talk:172.190.41.82|talk]]) 21:45, 19 December 2011 (UTC) == Recent - Iran == From nine minutes ago, claiming to have four. Two from Belarus and two from an unconfirmed. But, it's just a claim for now. http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20100804/ap_on_re_mi_ea/iran_missiles [[User:Brody Kennen|Brody Kennen]] ([[User talk:Brody Kennen|talk]]) 08:18, 4 August 2010 (UTC) :More recent info on Iran; major diplomatic work revealed by WL's leaked cables cover the subject of delays of the S-300 and the pressure US diplomats put on Russian officials to delay deliveries. They also outline that part of the concern is that these air defence weapons are capable of hitting aircraft well outside Iran's borders should they be deployed there.--[[User:Senor Freebie|Senor Freebie]] ([[User talk:Senor Freebie|talk]]) 12:43, 30 November 2010 (UTC) == Map of users == I have removed the map because it shows Iran as a user. Officially it has not received any, and the assertion that it has is not apparently based on confirmed reports. I would therefore suggest that it should be removed. We need a new map that shows official users, also showing countries that have ''ordered'' but not yet inducted such weapons in a different colour. The map does show other countries that do use the missile, but we shouldn't use images that show incorrect data. [[User:John Smith's|John Smith's]] ([[User talk:John Smith's|talk]]) 23:14, 1 November 2010 (UTC) == Produced by Samsung == The paragraph about the misile ever produced by Samsung is incorrect, and including it in the introduction paragraph sounds as if South Korea had a part in development. The reference listed there points to the following information, listing that only a letter of intent was signed: "The Russian arms manufacturer, Almaz, signs a letter of intent with South Korean firm Samsung for the joint production of the S-300 anti-missile system. Russia will probably sell a complete S-300 anti-missile system to South Korea." The sentence should be removed [[Special:Contributions/69.196.155.171|69.196.155.171]] ([[User talk:69.196.155.171|talk]]) 03:56, 4 April 2012 (UTC) == Combat history - Comparison with other systems == These sections are written in barely comprehensible English. I strongly suspect use of automatic translators. Citations are links to magazines in Russian, so I cannot correct mistakes nor control their veridicity. Editing is needed. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Peldrigal|Peldrigal]] ([[User talk:Peldrigal|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Peldrigal|contribs]]) 15:32, 18 May 2014 (UTC) :I deleted a huge chunk which was added in a single edit [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=S-300_%28missile%29&diff=579107025&oldid=578973998 diff] in 2013. If someone wants to work with the old citations, be my guess. [[User:Mangoe|Mangoe]] ([[User talk:Mangoe|talk]]) 00:18, 1 February 2015 (UTC) == S - 200 and S-300 == Command post S - 300 can manage in any combination the elements of S - 200 and S-300http://www.s300.ru/produce/adms/s300pmu2/83m6e2.aspxhttp://rbase.new-factoria.ru/missile/wobb/c300pmu2/c300pmu2.shtml — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/89.105.158.243|89.105.158.243]] ([[User talk:89.105.158.243|talk]]) 08:50, 14 September 2014 (UTC) == 40 km and a full automatic and other == it is well done? or there is a mistake for the correct wiki + * text * The S-300 system was first deployed by the [[Soviet Union]] in 1979, designed for the air defence of large industrial and administrative facilities, military bases, and control of airspace against enemy strike aircraft. For the first time in the world received the technical functions.http://www.webcitation.org/6HjbJTzLYhttp://www.raspletin.ru/zenitnye-raketnye-sistemy-ryada-s-300p The system is fully automated, people observe and confirm Manual operation possible too.http://army-news.ru/2010/10/kompleks-s300-vpervye-porazil/http://www.km.ru/node/720374/comments5 Components may be near the central command post, or relegated to 40 km. Each radar gives target designation for the central command post. CP compares all the data received from the radar targeting remote with each other up to 80 km and filters a false target, very difficult to score interference such greater distances.http://topwar.ru/28808-aviaciya-nato-protiv-siriyskih-s300.html Possible active and passive target detection for the transfer target indication for central command posthttp://www.kapyar.ru/index.php?pg=243http://www.modernarmy.ru/article/278/zenitno-raketnaya-sistema-s-300v. == Poor English == The article contains very poor English. The Specifications section is especially bad. I understand Russians want to show off its capabilities but the atrocious translation needs to be fixed. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/67.82.53.0|67.82.53.0]] ([[User talk:67.82.53.0|talk]]) 02:19, 12 February 2015 (UTC) == Bad translation / Omission? == The 5th sentence is either a poor translation or missing some words: "For the first time in the world received the technical functions." Can someone fix this? --[[User:Sceasary|Sceasary]] ([[User talk:Sceasary|talk]]) 13:53, 13 April 2015 (UTC) first - yes, in the world - yes, and the translation is not good.14:25, 13 April 2015 (UTC)[[Special:Contributions/212.119.233.45|212.119.233.45]] ([[User talk:212.119.233.45|talk]]) "The system can destroy ground targets at a range of 120 km (19,000 fragments or 36,000 according to various missiles). And if the S-300 missiles will be specially nearly ballistic missile launched while the range reaches up to 400 km" ?What? [[Special:Contributions/118.101.189.187|118.101.189.187]] ([[User talk:118.101.189.187|talk]]) 15:07, 8 November 2015 (UTC)bankrobber70 Seems like a lot of this is translated poorly from russian, especially the specifications part. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/23.17.9.69|23.17.9.69]] ([[User talk:23.17.9.69|talk]]) 23:31, 25 November 2015 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[S-300 (missile)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=680122374 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20071229150341/http://edition.cnn.com:80/2007/WORLD/europe/12/28/iran.russia.ap/index.html to http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/europe/12/28/iran.russia.ap/index.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers. —[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 21:20, 8 September 2015 (UTC) == North Korean S300 == NKor KNDR (DPRK) have it also local made KN06 SAM with flap lid (other radar ? idk) and range atleast 150 Km (or 300?) . --[[User:Zafer14ur8|Zafer14ur8]] ([[User talk:Zafer14ur8|talk]]) 14:53, 15 January 2016 (UTC) rub&sap it can not be checked very accurately[[Special:Contributions/188.162.80.2|188.162.80.2]] ([[User talk:188.162.80.2|talk]]) 12:23, 7 August 2016 (UTC) == I've did it :D == I learned damn hard the family box and added S300V4 in the diagram :D yee . --[[User:Zafer14ur8|Zafer14ur8]] ([[User talk:Zafer14ur8|talk]]) 14:53, 15 January 2016 (UTC) rub&sap like[[Special:Contributions/188.162.80.2|188.162.80.2]] ([[User talk:188.162.80.2|talk]]) 12:22, 7 August 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:4|one external link|4 external links}} on [[S-300 (missile system)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=748774323 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20130522172519/http://www.armyrecognition.com/s-300_variants_sol_air_missile_system_russia_uk/s-300pmu2_s-300_pmu2_sa-20b_gargoyle_b_surface_to_air_defense_missile_system_technical_data_sheet_uk.html to http://www.armyrecognition.com/s-300_variants_sol_air_missile_system_russia_uk/s-300pmu2_s-300_pmu2_sa-20b_gargoyle_b_surface_to_air_defense_missile_system_technical_data_sheet_uk.html *Corrected formatting/usage for http://www.raspletin.ru/zenitnye-raketnye-sistemy-ryada-s-300p *Corrected formatting/usage for http://pvo.guns.ru/other/slovakia/s300_nato.htm *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20131022154209/http://www15.rian.ru/ruharakter/20060920/54082336.html to http://www15.rian.ru/ruharakter/20060920/54082336.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 08:43, 10 November 2016 (UTC) == Very long note == :''I have cut this from the article as it is a gross abuse of footnotes. It may be useful somewhere else, so I have placed it here for a while:'' In return over S-300 (2007 version PMU-1 family of air defense) are offered in 2015 version of Antey-2500 (family army air defense) in the amount of 5 sets. In case of refusal will be delivered by S-400 but some years later.{{cite web|url=https://news.mail.ru/economics/21165547/?frommail=1|title=Зенитно-пакетный комплекс|work=Новости Mail.Ru|accessdate=1 April 2015}} Officially, the US expressed their protest.{{cite web|url=http://ria.ru/world/20150223/1049230534.html|title=Госдеп: США не хотят, чтобы Иран получил "Антей-2500" вместо С-300|work=РИА Новости|accessdate=1 April 2015}} Prohibition on the supply of S-300 system to Iran has been removed on 13 April 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.kremlin.ru/events/president/news/49248|title=Внесено изменение в Указ о мерах по выполнению резолюции Совета Безопасности ООН №1929|work=Президент России|accessdate=27 November 2015}}{{cite news|title=Putin lifts ban on delivery of S-300 missile systems to Iran|url=http://rt.com/news/249229-russia-s300-delivery-iran/|accessdate=13 April 2015|publisher=RT News|date=13 April 2015}} ''History of negotiations.'' Iran's status regarding the S-300 system remains controversial. Iran claimed to have signed a contract with Russia on 25 December 2007 on the sales of the S-300PMU-1 missile system.[[Fars News]] [http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=8610050354 Russia to Deliver S-300 Missile System to Iran] 26 December 2007 Russian officials have denied this.{{cite news|publisher=CNN |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/europe/12/28/iran.russia.ap/index.html |date=28 December 2007 |title=Russia denies missiles to Iran |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071229150341/http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/europe/12/28/iran.russia.ap/index.html |archivedate=29 December 2007 }} It has also been claimed that Croatia sold their S-300s to Iran.{{cite web|url=http://www.kommersant.com/p-13187/Iran_Croatia_/ |title=Croatia Suspected of Selling S-300 Antiaircraft Missiles to Iran |publisher=Kommersant.com |accessdate=14 November 2011}} Later, On 21 December, according to a senior Iranian lawmaker, Russia has started the supply of components for S-300 air defence systems to Iran. Esmaeil Kosari, deputy chairman of the parliamentary commission on national security and foreign policy, told the Iranian news agency IRNA that Iran and Russia had held negotiations for several years on the purchase of S-300 air defence systems and had finalized a deal. Kosari said the Islamic Republic would deploy S-300 surface-to-air missile systems to strengthen national defence on border areas.{{cite web|url=http://en.rian.ru/world/20081221/119041152.html |title=Russia starts S-300 missile supplies to Iran – Iranian MP | World | RIA Novosti |publisher=En.rian.ru |date=21 December 2008 |accessdate=14 November 2011}} On 28 October 2009, if asked when Russia would deliver the systems to Iran, Ivanov said: "There have been no such deliveries to date."{{cite web|url=http://en.rian.ru/russia/20091028/156624538.html |title=To date, Russia has not supplied S-300 SAM systems to Iran |publisher=En.rian.ru |date=28 October 2009 |accessdate=14 November 2011}} Yet on 23 December 2009, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Alexei Borodavkin said Russia sees no reason to cancel a deal to provide S-300s to Iran. He said ""Exports of such weapons is subject to no UN treaty or other bilateral agreements, This is why we see no essential reason to make any change in the deal," indicating that there is a deal.[[Press TV]] [http://www.presstv.com/detail.aspx?id=114515§ionid=351020101 Russia: No reason to cancel S-300 deal with Iran], 23 December 2009 On 8 February 2010, Iran announced that it had a "domestically-made" system called [[Bavar 373]] with the same capabilities as the S-300. In September 2012 Iran successfully tested [[Raad Air Defense System]] a partner for Bavar 373.{{cite web|url=http://www.tradearabia.com/news/newsdetails.asp?Sn=DEF&artid=174527 |title=Iran to unveil S300-type air defence system |publisher=Tradearabia.com |date=8 February 2010 |accessdate=14 November 2011}} Alexander Fumin has said that the delay in the delivery is due to a technical problem with the radiowave system.{{cite web|author=John Pike |url=http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/library/news/iran/2010/iran-100224-irna07.htm |title=Russian official: Moscow committed to its S-300 deal with Iran |publisher=Globalsecurity.org |accessdate=14 November 2011}} On 19 April 2010, Asr Iran (Iran's Era) website said that Iran could develop a similar air missiles system{{cite web|url=https://translate.google.com/translate?js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&layout=1&eotf=1&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.asriran.com%2Far%2Fpages%2F%3Fcid%3D22108&sl=ar&tl=en |title=مفاجأة الجيش الايراني: روسيا واسرائيل امام الامر الواقع |publisher=Google |accessdate=14 November 2011}} On 11 June 2010, Russia stopped sale of the S-300 air defence system to Iran in light of U.N. sanctions against Iran, stating that the "S-300s fall under these sanctions".{{cite news|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/06/11/AR2010061105248.html |work=The Washington Post |title=Russia halts sale of air defence missiles to Iran |first1=Glenn |last1=Kessler |first2=Keith B. |last2=Richburg |date=12 June 2010}} On 4 August 2010, Iran claimed it has obtained two S-300PT (SA-10) from Belarus and two others from another unspecified source despite Russian refusal to deliver them.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2010/08/04/iran-claims-obtained-s-surface-air-missiles-despite-russian-refusal-deliver/|title=Iran claims it have sophisticated anti-aircraft missiles despite Russian refusal to deliver|work=Fox News|accessdate=14 November 2014}} The Belarusian government has denied rumors that [[Minsk]] had allegedly sold S-300 air defence systems to Iran. "The State Military-Industrial Committee can officially state that Belarus has never held talks with Iran on the deliveries of the S-300 air defence systems", said committee's spokesman Vladimir Lavrenyuk. "Belarus has never supplied S-300 systems or their components to Iran," he said, adding that Minsk strictly complied with international arms control regulations.{{cite news|title=Belarus denies sales of S-300 air defence systems to Iran|url=http://en.rian.ru/mlitary_news/20100804/160070974.html|accessdate=16 August 2010|newspaper=RIA Novosti|date=4 August 2010}} On 22 September 2010, Russian President [[Dmitry Medvedev]] signed a decree banning the sale of the S-300 and other military equipment to Iran.{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2010/09/22/Russia-pulls-plug-on-Iran-arms-deal/UPI-49941285186093/ |title=Russia pulls plug on Iran arms deal |publisher=Upi.com |date=22 September 2010 |accessdate=14 November 2011}} The sale was canceled because of [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1929]] sanctions on Iran. On 10 November 2010 Iran announced that it had developed a version of the S-300 missile.{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2010/11/18/us-iran-military-missile-idUSTRE6AH2YW20101118|title=Iran says tests own model of Russian S-300 missile|work=Reuters|accessdate=14 November 2014}} However Pieter Wezeman of the [[Stockholm International Peace Research Institute]] has questioned Iran's ability to duplicate the Russian missile system.[http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/iran-plans-to-test-own-model-of-russia-s-300-missile-1.324008?localLinksEnabled=false "Iran plans to test own model of Russia S-300 missile."] [[Reuters]], 10 November 2010 And by 2012 the Iranian position had softened to merely considering the production of such a system.[http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/library/news/iran/2012/iran-120417-irna04.htm "Iran considering to substitute S-300 this year, defence minister."] Islamic Republic News Agency. 17 April 2012. In April 2012, Iran filed a lawsuit for $4 billion in damages for failure to deliver the missiles.[http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/library/news/iran/2012/iran-120705-rianovosti01.htm "Iran Demands, Bln From Russia Over Canceled Missile Deal."] RIA Novosti, 5 July 2012. Then Iran blamed foreign media for inflaming the situation when Russia threatened to reduce diplomatic support for Iran if the lawsuit continued.[http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/library/news/iran/2012/iran-120814-rianovosti01.htm "Iran Accuses Media of Inflaming S-300 Dispute."] RIA Novosti, 14 August 2012. Russian Technologies (Rostech) CEO Sergei Chemezov said on Thursday 30/05/2013 that the US applied heavy pressure on Moscow to stop the agreement under the pretext that the Iran-Russia deal was against UN Security Council sanctions imposed on the Islamic Republic. Chemezov, added, however, that Washington later changed its rhetoric, saying the UN resolution did not specifically mention the S-300 system and Russia had acted on its own. "The Americans now agree that it is a defensive system and Russia alone should be responsible for the breach of the contract," Ria Novosti quoted Chemezov as saying. He added that Moscow now seeks to reach a settlement with Tehran to withdraw its lawsuit against Russia's state-run arms export company Rosoboronexport over the canceled deal, saying Russia’s chances "to win the case are very slim."{{cite web|url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2013/05/31/306384/us-betrayed-russia-over-iran-s300-deal/|title=PressTV-'US betrayed Russia on Iran S-300 deal'|work=presstv.ir|accessdate=1 April 2015}} On 10 June 2013, Iran's ambassador to Russia rejected Russia's offer to substitute S-300 with Tor air defence system. Ambassador Seyed Mahmoud-Reza Sajjadi said Iran had developed a national defense system "and within that system the proposed Tor system would be unable to fulfill the S-300's functions."{{cite web|url=http://en.ria.ru/world/20130610/181598186/Iran-Rejects-Russias-S-300-Substitute-Offer.html|title=Iran Rejects Russia’s S-300 Substitute Offer / Sputnik international|publisher=|accessdate=14 November 2014}} In late August 2013, the Almaz-Antey Corporation said that the S-300 missiles that were to be delivered to Iran had been scrapped. Some dismantled parts that could be reused were saved, but the rest were completely scrapped. The S-300s could not be entirely re-sold to other buyers because requirements, specifications, and software are different for each particular client and cannot be adjusted. [[Rosoboronexport]] had no plans at the time to provide a replacement system,[http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/anti-aircraft-missile-system-bound-for-iran-scrapped/485251.html Anti-Aircraft Missile System Bound for Iran Scrapped] – Themoscowtimes.com, 30 August 2013 but reversed themselves in 2013 and decided to go forwards with the shipment in exchange for another $800 million payment.{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Defense/Report-Russia-to-supply-Iran-with-S-300-anti-aircraft-missiles-325843|title=Report: Russia to supply S-300 anti-aircraft missiles to Iran.|publisher=|accessdate=14 November 2014}} On 13 January 2014, it was revealed that Iran would send a delegation to Russia to discuss the delivery of a substitute missile system to the S-300, possibly the [[Tor missile system]], which was rejected in a previous offer, or the [[S-300VM]].[http://www.armyrecognition.com/january_2014_global_defense_security_news_industry/iran_to_send_delegation_to_russia_to_discuss_delivery_substitute_for_s-300_missile_system_1401144.html Iran to send a delegation to Russia to discuss the delivery of a substitute for S-300 missile system] – Armyrecognition.com, 14 January 2014 Negotiations resumed. Stated - S-300 and S-400 are likely to be delivered.{{cite web|url=http://lenta.ru/news/2015/01/21/s300/|title=Россия и Иран возобновят переговоры о поставке комплексов С-300|work=lenta.ru|accessdate=1 April 2015}} — Cheers, [[User:Steelpillow|Steelpillow]] ([[User Talk:Steelpillow|Talk]]) 13:54, 21 November 2016 (UTC)
